did.abstract: Norah Chase, an associate professor and activist in the Professional Staff Congress (PSC), the labor union representing college teachers in the City University of New York system, donated these delegate badges. The collection contains four badges from the 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th annual conventions of the Textile Workers of America. The conventions took place from 1906-1909 in New Jersey, Rhode Island, New York, and Washington, DC. Two badges are embellished with printed images.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged chronologically in one flat box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of four delegate badges from the 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th annual conventions of the Textile Workers of America. The United Textile Workers of America (UTW) was formed in 1901 as an affiliate of the American Federation of Labor (AFL). UTW famously organized a textile worker strike in the 1930s to protest poor working conditions during the Great Depression.Two badges are embellished with printed images and all are embellished with beaded appliqu√©. The conventions occured on the following dates: the 6th on October 16, 1906 in Patterson (sic), NJ; the 7th on October 14, 1907 in Providence, RI; the 8th on October 20, 1908 in Cohoes, NY; and the 9th on October 19, 1909 in Washington, DC.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Norah Chase was an associate professor of English at Kingsborough Community College in Brooklyn, N.Y., and a long-time activist in the Professional Staff Congress (PSC), the labor union representing college teachers in the City University of New York system. She collected these badges and other materials related to union activism and organizing.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection are in the public domain. Users need not secure permission from the Tamiment library to publish or reproduce materials in this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials received by Debra Bernhardt on December 8, 1995 at the Commerford Awards, and were gifted to Tamiment Library by Norah Chase in 1996. The materials were purchased by Chase at Bethken's Antiques Uniques in Phoenicia, NY.
